common_issues.title: Pieces OS Processing Errors
common_issues.description: Users report processing errors in Pieces OS, primarily related to cloud features like GPT models and LTM engine.  Suggested workarounds include restarting, checking for updates, and contacting support. The Pieces team is actively investigating and implementing solutions, including rate limit adjustments and authentication for cloud processing.

related_issues.title: I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
related_issues.text:
I can't use any GPT models other than 'GPT-4o Mini'
### Software

Desktop Application, JetBrains, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

If the model is 4o Mini, everything works fine.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

- User reported an issue with Copilot processing.
- The message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few minutes and try again." is displayed.

**Problems Identified:**

- Copilot is experiencing processing errors.
- The issue may be related to similar reported incidents.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The Pieces support bot triaged the issue and routed it to the appropriate team member.
- Related issues are suggested for reference.
- User is advised to consult additional resources while awaiting a follow-up.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue is being investigated by the Pieces team.
- No resolution has been implemented yet.
- User is awaiting a response from the support team.

related_issues.title: I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.13

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[com.pieces.pfd.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17891327/com.pieces.pfd.zip)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9a6f930-4d30-41ad-8d70-b81d9c3f7e6f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99d91958-8fb7-4f27-9efa-9d628127e90f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d1c630b-816c-488d-87f9-202a86d63820)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e8278a0-eca0-4b4e-bcaa-a5b195da5562)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing."

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users were encountering an error message stating "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing."
* Initial speculation pointed towards VPN usage as the cause.
* Further investigation revealed rate limiting as the root issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* User inability to utilize cloud processing due to rate limiting.
* Lack of comprehensive error message to inform users of the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Manual adjustment of rate limits for affected users.
* Implementation of authentication for cloud processing in the long term.
* Improved error message with explanation and instructions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Rate limiting issue appears to be resolved.
* Manual adjustments for affected users are ongoing.
* Authentication for cloud processing in development.

**Additional Points:**

* User communication and updates provided by @mark-at-pieces.
* Offer of further assistance for persistent issues.

**Overall:**

While the initial rate limiting issue caused inconvenience, the Pieces team has actively addressed the problem and offered solutions. Continued development and communication ensure a positive user experience.

related_issues.title: Can't turn on long term memory engine
related_issues.text:
Can't turn on long term memory engine
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i keep clicking on the button but the ltm engine wont turn on
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d91ee8ce-b8e1-4f28-9785-02d488d88775)

## Summary of GitHub Issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* User (@sh02sahil) created an issue regarding the LTM engine not starting in Pieces OS.
* User reported trying restarts, switching between local and cloud modes, but none of these solutions worked.
* User confirmed they tried the suggested related issues and resources.

**Problems identified:**

* The LTM engine wouldn't start in Pieces OS.
* The application couldn't find the update.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team suggested trying a newly released version (11.0.0) that might have a fix.
* Pieces team offered to schedule a call to discuss the issue further.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User is waiting for the update to become available.
* User booked a call with the Pieces team to discuss the issue and other questions.

**Additional notes:**

* The user mentioned encountering other issues and needing help.
* The Pieces team expressed their awareness of the issue and offered their assistance.

**Important details:**

* User confirmed trying suggested solutions and resources.
* User acknowledged the possibility of a fix in the new version.
* User will provide further updates after testing the update.

**Overall, the conversation suggests ongoing communication between the user and the Pieces team to resolve the LTM engine issue and address other concerns.**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Plugin Connectivity Issues After Update
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS plugins for VS Code and PHPStorm breaking after updating to version 11.0.0.  The issue seems to stem from port conflicts or plugin incompatibility with the new version.  Suggested solutions include ensuring Pieces OS is running on the correct port (5323 or 1000), checking for plugin updates, and potentially downgrading Pieces OS until compatible plugin versions are available.

related_issues.title: Pieces os says: port already in use if i start phpstorm with pieces plugin
related_issues.text:
Pieces os says: port already in use if i start phpstorm with pieces plugin
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0 2024-12-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

if i start my computer, pieces-os starts. Then, if i start phpstorm, there's a message: 
> It looks like port 5323 is occupied by another application. Pieces OS uses this port to communicate with plugins. Please, enable Pieces OS to run on port 5323.

Even if I kill the pieces-os on port 5323 and start up phpstorm, it still get's this error. So it looks like phpstorm is trying to start piecec-os again, and I think more than once.
I did snap refresh pieces-os => snap "pieces-os" has no updates available
php storm plugin is to be 10.0.0

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* @micksp reported an issue with the Pieces OS Jetbrains plugin not working.
* The author suggests checking similar issues 530, 421, and 474 for solutions.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces OS Jetbrains plugin is not functioning properly.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The author recommends consulting related issues for possible solutions.
* There is no mention of implemented solutions in the provided conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ends with a note about follow-up within 24 hours.
* The outcome of the issue remains unresolved in the provided snippet.

**Additional Information:**

* The author provides helpful resources for troubleshooting and documentation.

**Note:** This summary is based on the provided excerpt of the conversation. More information may be available in the full conversation thread.

related_issues.title: Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
related_issues.text:
Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working after Pieces OS update
### Software

VS Code, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Yesterday was working great. Minutes ago it prompt me to update Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers. After the update both Vscode and PHPStorm plugins stopped working.

PHPStorm says - It looks like port 1000 is occupied by another application. Pieces OS uses this port to communicate with plugins. Please, enable Pieces OS to run on port 1000.

And Vscode says - Please update the Pieces for VS Code extension to the latest version. This version is only compatible with Pieces OS versions less than 11.0.0, and  you have 11.0.0 installed. But there isn't any Vscode plugin update.

Can you help? Is there a way to downgrade?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/973ecc53-1230-4b25-93df-b8f258273f19)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0d82807-7d45-4279-af39-b223896bd4ca)

## Conversation Summary

**Key Point:**

* Rafael encountered a suspicious access notification from their antivirus upon updating Pieces OS.

**Problem Identified:**

* Rafael's antivirus flagged the Pieces OS update as suspicious.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark acknowledged the new update and confirmed a build for VsCode is underway.
* Mark requested further information regarding any additional issues besides the antivirus flag.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The status of the antivirus issue and Rafael's experience remains unclear.
* Mark offered support and requested more details to investigate.

**Additional Notes:**

* The update was released just 15 minutes prior to Rafael's comment.
* Rafael mentioned other users may report the update as suspicious.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS LLM Engine Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties with Pieces OS LLM engine, including failed downloads due to unstable connections and issues activating the engine. Proposed solutions involve manual workarounds, waiting for new releases with improved infrastructure, and direct support from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Manually downloading a LLM
related_issues.text:
Manually downloading a LLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I am attempting to install Pieces with a local LLM. Unfortunately, I have an unstable network connection (which is why I want a local model in the first place.) I am trying to get Mistral-7B.

I found that Pieces wants to download the whole model (4 GB) all at once. If it fails for whatever reason, it restarts from the beginning.  This is annoying and it makes downloading virtually impossible, because my network connection does not stay long enough to pull 4GB in one go.

I have figured out where the file is being downloaded to and from, and managed to download it manually with wget. Now the problem is that Pieces refuses to recognize it. Even if I put it in the right place, the Pieces app stil shows the Download button in the UI, and clicking Download truncates the file to zero and starts the download from the beginning.

I tried to edit models.db and change "downloaded" to true in the relevant line, but it has no effect.

Is there anything else I could do?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@ekuznetsov139) reported an issue with importing a manually downloaded LLM model.
* hra42 suggests the problem lies in Pieces' integration process, not just the raw model download.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces deletes partially downloaded models due to potential corruption.
* User's attempt to update the database property wasn't enough to resolve the issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Temporary workaround:**
    1. Shutdown Pieces.
    2. Add an empty "download_success.txt" file to the specified directory.
    3. Restart Pieces.
* **Long-term solution:**
    - Upcoming Pieces release will overhaul the LLM infrastructure, enabling restarting failed downloads.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user can try the temporary workaround until the new release with the improved infrastructure is available.
* The new release is expected within the next day or two.
* The issue will be resolved with the new release's ability to resume interrupted downloads.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with links to relevant resources, including existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are reporting various issues with the Pieces Desktop App on Windows, including taskbar hiding, loss of connection to PiecesOS, and app crashes when uploading files. Troubleshooting steps involve checking system compatibility, ensuring a stable internet connection, and providing detailed bug reports with reproducible steps. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and working on solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@omkar-4) is experiencing crashes with PiecesOS when starting the Pieces for Devs Desktop App.
* The issue seems related to files/folders being used as context.

**Problems identified:**

* Crashes are occurring.
* Problem is difficult to reproduce due to reliance on specific files and folders.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team requested the user to share the files/folders causing the crashes.
* Sharing the files will help reproduce the issue and identify the root cause.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue remains open and unresolved.
* User has not yet provided the requested files/folders.

**Additional notes:**

* The user was provided with links to related issues, documentation, and helpful resources.

## Key Takeaways

* The user is experiencing a specific crash related to files/folders as context.
* The Pieces team needs more information to diagnose the issue.
* Sharing the problematic files/folders is crucial to resolving the problem.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS processing errors:** This issue is the most frequent and has the highest activity level. Focus on addressing the root causes, such as rate limit adjustments and authentication for cloud processing.

**Investigate plugin connectivity issues after the 11.0.0 update:** Many users are experiencing broken plugins for VS Code and PHPStorm. Determine the cause of the port conflicts or incompatibility and provide a solution, such as plugin updates or clear instructions for port configuration.

**Improve communication around LLM engine issues:** Users are facing difficulties with LLM engine downloads and activation. Provide clear workarounds, communicate timelines for new releases with improved infrastructure, and offer personalized support for complex cases.

**Address Pieces Desktop App issues on Windows:** Investigate and resolve reported issues like taskbar hiding, connection losses, and app crashes. Ensure system compatibility, provide troubleshooting steps, and consider releasing updates to address these problems.

**Proactively monitor and address emerging issues:** Regularly analyze support tickets for new trends and common problems. This will help identify and address emerging issues before they escalate and impact a larger user base.

**Improve self-service resources:** Enhance documentation, FAQs, and knowledge base articles to address common issues and questions. This will empower users to troubleshoot problems independently and reduce the load on the support team.

**Consider implementing a status page:** A public status page can keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned maintenance, and service disruptions. This transparency can improve user satisfaction and reduce support inquiries during outages.

**Gather user feedback on support experience:** Regularly collect feedback from users on their support experience. This can provide valuable insights into areas for improvement and help tailor support operations to better meet user needs.
